article.bibl: Marie [Guyart]Letter XCII, to her son, Québec, 14-27 September 1645, in Marie de l'Incarnation [Marie Guyart], Correspondance, ed. Dom Guy Oury (Solesmes: Abbaye Saint-Pierre, 1971), 252.
English translation, Word From New France: The Selected Letters of Marie de l'Incarnation, trans. and ed. Joyce Marshall (Toronto: Oxford University Press, 1967), 138.

William N. Fenton, "Wampum, the Magnet That Drew Furs from the Forest," chapter 16 of his The Great Law of the Longhouse: A Political History of the Iroquois Confederacy (Norman: University of Oklahoma Press, 1998), 224-39
Lynn Ceci; see her "The First Fiscal Crisis in New York," Economic Development and Cultural Change 28.4 (1979-80): 839-47,
[Lynn Ceci] "The Value of Wampum Among the New York Iroquois: A Case Study in Artifact Analysis," Anthropological Research 38.1 (1982): 97-107
[Lynn Ceci] The Effect of European Contact and Trade on the Settlement Pattern of Indians in Coastal New York 1524-1655: The Archaeological and Documentary Evidence (New York: Garland, 1990)

Ceci in "Tracing Wampum's Origins: Shell Bead Evidence from Archaeological Sites in Western and Coastal New York," Proceedings of the 1986 Shell Bead Conference: Selected Papers, ed. Charles F. Hayes and Lynn Ceci (Rochester, N.Y.: Rochester Museum and Science Center, 1988), 63-80
Richard W. Yerkes, "Shell Bead Production and Exchange in Prehistoric Mississippian Populations," 113-23
Patricia Seed, Ceremonies of Possession in Europe's Conquest of the New World, 1492-1640 (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1995)

Brian Stock, in The Implications of Literacy: Written Language and Models of Interpretation in the Eleventh and Twelfth Centuries (Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1983)

[David Olson] "Towards a Psychology of Literacy: On the Relations Between Speech and Writing," Cognition 60 (1996): 83-104

Peter Kalm, Travels in North America [1753-61], ed. Adolph B. Benson (New York: Dover Press, 1966), 2:473.

François Melançon considers the case of New France; see his "Façonner et surveiller l'intime: lire en Nouvelle-France," in Manon Brunet and Serge Gagnon, eds., Discours et pratiques de l'intime (Québec: IQRC, 1993), 17-45

"Signs and Their Transmission: The Question of the Book in the New World" (220-70)

The letter is from Carletonto Lord Hillsborough, 10 April 1770. London: PRO: CO42/7, fols. 157 and 159 (Patricia Fleming, personal communication) [MB: I have no idea what this is, other than perhaps a tip off to the repository info?]
